id.desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

dim.desc:
Dimension index of coordinate axis. For example, [series-parallel.data][0] is the following data: 

    [
        [1,  55,  9,   56,  0.46,  18,  6,  'good'],
        [2,  25,  11,  21,  0.65,  34,  9,  'excellent'],
        [3,  56,  7,   63,  0.3,   14,  5,  'good'],
        [4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
        { // Data item can also be an Object, so that perticular settings of its line can be set here.
            value: [5,  42,  24,  44,  0.76,  40,  16, 'excellent']
            lineStyle: {...},
        }
        ...
    ]
    

In data above, each row is a "data item", and each column represents a "dimension". For example, the meanings of columns above are: "data", "AQI", "PM2.5", "PM10", "carbon monoxide level", "nitrogen dioxide level", and "sulfur dioxide level". dim defines which dimension (which _row_) of data would map to this axis. Started from 0. For example, if the dim of coordinate axis is 1, it indicates that the second row of data would map to this axis.

[0]: #series-parallel.data

realtime.desc: Whether to refresh view when brush-selecting axis. If is set to be false, view is updated after brush-selecting action ends. When data amount is large, it is suggested to set to be false to avoid efficiency problems.

areaSelectStyle.desc: Area selecting is available on axes. Here is some configurations.

areaSelectStyle.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the select box.

areaSelectStyle.borderColor.desc: Border color of the select box.

areaSelectStyle.color.desc: Border fill color of the select box.

type.desc:
Type of axis. Option: 

* 'value' Numerical axis, suitable for continuous data.
* 'category' Category axis, suitable for discrete category data. Category data can be auto retrieved from [series.data][0] or [dataset.source][1], or can be specified via [parallelAxis.data][2].
* 'time' Time axis, suitable for continuous time series data. As compared to value axis, it has a better formatting for time and a different tick calculation method. For example, it decides to use month, week, day or hour for tick based on the range of span.
* 'log' Log axis, suitable for log data.



[0]: #series.data
[1]: #dataset.source
[2]: #parallelAxis.data

nameTextStyle.color.desc:
Color of axis name uses [axisLine.lineStyle.color][0] by default.

[0]: #parallelAxis.axisLine.lineStyle.color

nameTextStyle.fontStyle.desc:
axis name font style. Options are: 

* 'normal'
* 'italic'
* 'oblique'

nameTextStyle.fontWeight.desc:
axis name font thick weight. Options are: 

* 'normal'
* 'bold'
* 'bolder'
* 'lighter'
* 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

nameTextStyle.fontFamily.desc: axis name font family. Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

nameTextStyle.borderColor.desc: Border color of the text fragment.

nameTextStyle.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

nameTextStyle.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With borderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    borderType: [5, 10],
    
    borderDashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

nameTextStyle.borderDashOffset.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the line dash offset. With borderType , we can make the line style more flexible. Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset

nameTextStyle.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

nameTextStyle.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example: 

* padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]: represents padding of [top, right, bottom, left].
* padding: 4: represents padding: [4, 4, 4, 4].
* padding: [3, 4]: represents padding: [3, 4, 3, 4].

Notice, width and height specifies the width and height of the content, without padding.

nameTextStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

nameTextStyle.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

nameTextStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

nameTextStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

nameTextStyle.textBorderWidth.desc: Storke line width of the text.

nameTextStyle.textBorderType.desc:
Stroke line type of the text. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With textBorderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    textBorderType: [5, 10],
    
    textBorderDashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

nameTextStyle.textBorderDashOffset.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the line dash offset. With textBorderType , we can make the line style more flexible. Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset

nameTextStyle.textShadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

nameTextStyle.textShadowBlur.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

nameTextStyle.textShadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

nameTextStyle.textShadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

nameTextStyle.overflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when width is set. 

* 'truncate' Truncate the text and trailing with ellipsis.
* 'break' Break by word
* 'breakAll' Break by character.

nameTextStyle.ellipsis.desc: Ellipsis to be displayed when overflow is set to truncate.

nameTextStyle.lineOverflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow on height. 

* 'truncate' Truncate the overflow lines.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.borderCo.desc: Border color of the text fragment.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.borderWi.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'

    borderDashOffset: 5

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.borderRa.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example: 

* padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]: represents padding of [top, right, bottom, left].
* padding: 4: represents padding: [4, 4, 4, 4].
* padding: [3, 4]: represents padding: [3, 4, 3, 4].

Notice, width and height specifies the width and height of the content, without padding.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.shadowCo.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.shadowBl.desc: Show blur of the text block.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.shadowOf.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.
Shadow Y offset of the text block.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.width.desc: Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see backgroundColor). Notice, width and height specifies the width and height of the content, without padding. width can also be percent string, like '100%', which represents the percent of contentWidth (that is, the width without padding) of its container box. It is based on contentWidth because that each text fragment is layout based on the content box, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on outerWith in prectice. Notice, width and height only work when rich specified.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.height.desc: Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see backgroundColor). Notice, width and height specifies the width and height of the content, without padding. Notice, width and height only work when rich specified.

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.textBord.desc: Storke line width of the text.

Stroke line type of the text. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With textBorderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    textBorderType: [5, 10],
    
    textBorderDashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

nameTextStyle.rich.<style_name>.textShad.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.
Shadow blue of the text itself.
Shadow X offset of the text itself.
Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

nameGap.desc: Gap between axis name and axis line.

inverse.desc: Set this to true to invert the axis. This is a new option available from Echarts 3 and newer.

boundaryGap.desc:
The boundary gap on both sides of a coordinate axis. The setting and behavior of category axes and non-category axes are different. The boundaryGap of category axis can be set to either true or false. Default value is set to be true, in which case [axisTick][0] is served only as a separation line, and labels and data appear only in the center part of two [axis ticks][0], which is called _band_. For non-category axis, including time, numerical value, and log axes, boundaryGap is an array of two values, representing the spanning range between minimum and maximum value. The value can be set in numeric value or relative percentage, which becomes invalid after setting [min][1] and [max][2]. **Example:**    boundaryGap: ['20%', '20%']
    



[0]: #parallelAxis.axisTick
[1]: #parallelAxis.min
[2]: #parallelAxis.max

scale.desc:
It is available only in numerical axis, i.e., [type][0]: 'value'. It specifies whether not to contain zero position of axis compulsively. When it is set to be true, the axis may not contain zero position, which is useful in the scatter chart for both value axes. This configuration item is unavailable when the [min][1] and [max][2] are set.

[0]: #parallelAxis.type
[1]: #parallelAxis.min
[2]: #parallelAxis.max

splitNumber.desc: Number of segments that the axis is split into. Note that this number serves only as a recommendation, and the true segments may be adjusted based on readability. This is unavailable for category axis.

interval.desc:
Compulsively set segmentation interval for axis. As [splitNumber][0] is a recommendation value, the calculated tick may not be the same as expected. In this case, interval should be used along with [min][1] and [max][2] to compulsively set tickings. But in most cases, we do not suggest using this, out automatic calculation is enough for most situations. This is unavailable for category axis. Timestamp should be passed for [type][3]: 'time' axis. Logged value should be passed for [type][3]: 'log' axis.

[0]: #parallelAxis.splitNumber
[1]: #parallelAxis.min
[2]: #parallelAxis.max
[3]: #parallelAxis.type

logBase.desc:
Base of logarithm, which is valid only for numeric axes with [type][0]: 'log'.

[0]: #parallelAxis.type

silent.desc: Set this to true, to prevent interaction with the axis.

axisLine.show.desc: Set this to false to prevent the axis line from showing.

axisLine.symbol.desc: Symbol of the two ends of the axis. It could be a string, representing the same symbol for two ends; or an array with two string elements, representing the two ends separately. It's set to be 'none' by default, meaning no arrow for either end. If it is set to be 'arrow', there shall be two arrows. If there should only one arrow at the end, it should set to be ['none', 'arrow'].

axisLine.symbolSize.desc: Size of the arrows at two ends. The first is the width perpendicular to the axis, the next is the width parallel to the axis.

axisLine.symbolOffset.desc: Arrow offset of axis. If is array, the first number is the offset of the arrow at the beginning, and the second number is the offset of the arrow at the end. If is number, it means the arrows have the same offset.

axisLine.lineStyle.color.desc:
line styleLine color. 

> Supports setting as solid color using > rgb(255,255,255)> , > rgba(255,255,255,1)> , > #fff> , etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [> option.color][0]>  for details 

[0]: #color

axisLine.lineStyle.type.desc:
line type. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With dashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    type: [5, 10],
    
    dashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

axisLine.lineStyle.dashOffset.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the line dash offset. With type , we can make the line style more flexible. Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset

axisLine.lineStyle.cap.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To specify how to draw the end points of the line. Possible values are: 

* 'butt': The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
* 'round': The ends of lines are rounded.
* 'square': The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is 'butt'. Refer to MDN [lineCap][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap

axisLine.lineStyle.join.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet. Possible values are: 

* 'bevel': Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
* 'round': Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
* 'miter': Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the miterLimit property.

Default value is 'bevel'. Refer to MDN [lineJoin][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin

axisLine.lineStyle.miterLimit.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when join is set as miter. Default value is 10. Negative、0、Infinity and NaN values are ignored. Refer to MDN [miterLimit][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit

axisLine.lineStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as color.

axisLine.lineStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

axisLine.lineStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

axisLine.lineStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

axisTick.show.desc: Set this to false to prevent the axis tick from showing.

axisTick.alignWithLabel.desc:
Align axis tick with label, which is available only when boundaryGap is set to be true in category axis. See the following picture: 

![][0]



[0]: documents/asset/img/axis-align-with-label.png

axisTick.interval.desc:
Interval of axisTick, which is available in category axis. is set to be the same as [axisLabel.interval][0] by default. It uses a strategy that labels do not overlap by default. You may set it to be 0 to display all labels compulsively. If it is set to be 1, it means that labels are shown once after one label. And if it is set to be 2, it means labels are shown once after two labels, and so on. On the other hand, you can control by callback function, whose format is shown below: 

    (index:number, value: string) => boolean
    

The first parameter is index of category, and the second parameter is the name of category. The return values decides whether to display label.

[0]: #parallelAxis.axisLabel.interval

axisTick.inside.desc: Set this to true so the axis labels face the inside direction.

axisTick.length.desc: The length of the axis tick.

axisTick.lineStyle.color.desc:
Color of axis label is set to be [axisLine.lineStyle.color][0] by default.

[0]: #parallelAxis.axisLine.lineStyle.color

axisLabel.show.desc: Set this to false to prevent the axis label from appearing.

axisLabel.interval.desc:
Interval of Axis label, which is available in category axis. It uses a strategy that labels do not overlap by default. You may set it to be 0 to display all labels compulsively. If it is set to be 1, it means that labels are shown once after one label. And if it is set to be 2, it means labels are shown once after two labels, and so on. On the other hand, you can control by callback function, whose format is shown below: 

    (index:number, value: string) => boolean
    

The first parameter is index of category, and the second parameter is the name of category. The return values decides whether to display label.

axisLabel.inside.desc: Set this to true so the axis labels face the inside direction.

axisLabel.rotate.desc: Rotation degree of axis label, which is especially useful when there is no enough space for category axis. Rotation degree is from -90 to 90.

axisLabel.margin.desc: The margin between the axis label and the axis line.

axisLabel.showMinLabel.desc: Whether to show the label of the min tick. Optional values: true, false, null. It is auto determined by default, that is, if labels are overlapped, the label of the min tick will not be displayed.

axisLabel.showMaxLabel.desc: Whether to show the label of the max tick. Optional values: true, false, null. It is auto determined by default, that is, if labels are overlapped, the label of the max tick will not be displayed.

axisLabel.hideOverlap.desc: >  Since > v5.2.0 Whether to hide overlapped labels.

axisLabel.borderColor.desc: Border color of the text fragment.

axisLabel.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

axisLabel.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With borderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    borderType: [5, 10],
    
    borderDashOffset: 5
    }

* padding: [3, 4]: represents padding: [3, 4, 3, 4].

axisLabel.textShadowBlur.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

axisLabel.textShadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

axisLabel.textShadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

axisLabel.overflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when width is set. 

* 'truncate' Truncate the text and trailing with ellipsis.
* 'break' Break by word
* 'breakAll' Break by character.

axisLabel.ellipsis.desc: Ellipsis to be displayed when overflow is set to truncate.

axisLabel.lineOverflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow on height. 

* 'truncate' Truncate the overflow lines.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderColor.desc: Border color of the text fragment.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With borderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    borderType: [5, 10],
    
    borderDashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderDashOf.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the line dash offset. With borderType , we can make the line style more flexible. Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example: 

* padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]: represents padding of [top, right, bottom, left].
* padding: 4: represents padding: [4, 4, 4, 4].
* padding: [3, 4]: represents padding: [3, 4, 3, 4].

Notice, width and height specifies the width and height of the content, without padding.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowOffset.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.
Shadow Y offset of the text block.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.width.desc: Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see backgroundColor). Notice, width and height specifies the width and height of the content, without padding. width can also be percent string, like '100%', which represents the percent of contentWidth (that is, the width without padding) of its container box. It is based on contentWidth because that each text fragment is layout based on the content box, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on outerWith in prectice. Notice, width and height only work when rich specified.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.height.desc: Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see backgroundColor). Notice, width and height specifies the width and height of the content, without padding. Notice, width and height only work when rich specified.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderWi.desc: Storke line width of the text.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderTy.desc:
Stroke line type of the text. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With textBorderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    textBorderType: [5, 10],
    
    textBorderDashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderDa.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the line dash offset. With textBorderType , we can make the line style more flexible. Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowCo.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowBl.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

axisLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowOf.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.
Shadow Y offset of the text itself.
